In addition to the two $80,000 grants mentioned above, the NAEB
also received a grant in 1953 of $30,000 to be used by the Pacifica Foundation
(operators of educational FM station KPFA, Berkeley, California) to produce
several series of radio programs for their own use and for distribution by the
NAEB radio network. The NAEB is proud of the significant pioneering by KPFA
which this grant made possible,
The grants enumerated above made possible the production of 26 series
of radio programs totalling 263 individual programs. The number of NAEB
radio stations alone carrying these programs (and many have since been used
abroad and on commercial stations and national commercial networks), multi¬
plied by the total length of all programs, resulted in more than 6,000 hours of
air time made possible by these grants — hours of outstanding educational
programming, brought to the people of many communities all over the nation
and the world — programs that would not have been possible otherwise .
In addition to the radio program grants made above, grants were made
for 12 series of television programs for distribution by the Educational Tele¬
vision and Radio Center, The NAEB handled only the administrative details of
these grants, however, and is not in a position to make a detailed report on
the use of these programs by the few ETV stations then in operation, or sub¬
sequent uses.
After 1953 no further monies for program Grants-in-Aid were allotted
directly to the NAEB by the FAE, it being considered preferable (in agreement
with the NAEB) to handle all program grant funds through NET as the program
